articles.headline: China’s Commodity Buying Spree
articles.snippet: Shipping and commodity executives are questioning China’s motives as it piles up extra quantities of products.
articles.abstract: Shipping and commodity executives are questioning China’s motives as it piles up extra quantities of products.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG  Strong buying by China has helped lift commodity prices around the world this spring, but growing evidence suggests that a sizable portion of this buying has been to build stockpiles in China, and may not be sustainable.

articles.headline: U.S. Saw Problems on the Way at Merrill
articles.snippet: E-mails from the Federal Reserve indicate Bank of America’s executives were pressed to stay quiet about Merrill Lynch’s financial condition, a document written by House Republicans claims.
articles.abstract: E-mails from the Federal Reserve indicate Bank of America’s executives were pressed to stay quiet about Merrill Lynch’s financial condition, a document written by House Republicans claims.
articles.lead_paragraph: Alarm was rising inside the Federal Reserve.
articles.byline: By Louise Story and Jo Becker

articles.headline: U.S. Commander in Afghanistan Is Given More Leeway
articles.snippet: Gen. Stanley McChrystal has a wide berth to pick a dream team of subordinates as he moves to carry out a new strategy for combating the Taliban.
articles.abstract: Gen. Stanley McChrystal has a wide berth to pick a dream team of subordinates as he moves to carry out a new strategy for combating the Taliban.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The new American commander in Afghanistan has been given carte blanche to handpick a dream team of subordinates, including many Special Operations veterans, as he moves to carry out an ambitious new strategy that envisions stepped-up attacks on Taliban fighters and narcotics networks.
articles.byline: By Thom Shanker and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Kerkorian’s Stakes May Be Down, but He Has Bounced Back Before
articles.snippet: Kirk Kerkorian’s bets on MGM Mirage and Ford are not panning out at the moment, but companies in distress have always been his specialty.
articles.abstract: Kirk Kerkorian’s bets on MGM Mirage and Ford are not panning out at the moment, but companies in distress have always been his specialty.
articles.lead_paragraph: Can a billionaire make a comeback in his 90s?

articles.headline: U.S. Takes On the Insular G.M. Culture
articles.snippet: Changing the culture at General Motors is expected to be a significant challenge for the government.
articles.abstract: Changing the culture at General Motors is expected to be a significant challenge for the government.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  Fiat will set a new direction at Chrysler, which finished its tour through bankruptcy court Wednesday, completing its deal to join forces with the Italian automaker.

articles.headline: In Iran Race, Ex-Leader Works to Oust President
articles.snippet: Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani has helped define the race by his feud with President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.
articles.abstract: Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani has helped define the race by his feud with President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN  In a makeshift campaign war room in north Tehran, two dozen young women clad in head scarves and black chadors are logging election data into desktop computers 24 hours a day, while men rush around them carrying voter surveys and district maps.

articles.headline: Overseer of Big Pay Is Seasoned Arbitrator
articles.snippet: Kenneth R. Feinberg, appointed by the Obama administration as the compensation official for companies on federal assistance, has experience in mediating complicated disputes.
articles.abstract: Kenneth R. Feinberg, appointed by the Obama administration as the compensation official for companies on federal assistance, has experience in mediating complicated disputes.
articles.lead_paragraph: If there is one thing Kenneth R. Feinberg does not like to be called, it is a czar.
articles.byline: By Louise Story and Stephen Labaton

articles.headline: U.S. Pushes a Troubled Citigroup to Heal Itself
articles.snippet: As other banks prepare to exit the bailout program, the government is tightening its grip on Citigroup, calling for change at the bank.
articles.abstract: As other banks prepare to exit the bailout program, the government is tightening its grip on Citigroup, calling for change at the bank.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tough words from Washington arrived by phone on Tuesday at Citigroup headquarters in New York.

articles.headline: Europe Lags as U.S. Economy Shows Signs of Recovery
articles.snippet: The diverging fortunes of the U.S. and Europe show the perils and upsides of the recovery plans of each.
articles.abstract: The diverging fortunes of the U.S. and Europe show the perils and upsides of the recovery plans of each.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS  There was more evidence Thursday that the United States economy might be stabilizing, if not rebounding, even as economic reports in Europe remained gloomy.
